content: Given that Observation.subject could be a Patient, Group, Device, or Location; and given that there is a 'patient' search parameter. Can I simply search using &patient.identifier=urn:oid:1.2.3.4|5678? To get all the Observations where the Patient has an identifier given. Meaning the search parameter has already set the type of subject to Patient, so no need to do the [type]/[id] ---- the example for this on http://hl7-fhir.github.io/search.html#reference is telling us different. But this example is not showing the use of the 'patient' search parameter, always using 'subject'.
The patient search parameter constrains the type to Patient only, so I believe the answer to that question is "yes".
can this be added as an example on the search.html#reference page? just one more example.
I'm not sure it would add that much.
I would say the semantics are unclear. Or can someone point to a description of how the patient search parameter is supposed to work?
I could not find it either . Is basically a shortcut for ' GET [base]/Observation?subject:Patient=[id]' created a tracker [#9923]
